intro: Dicraurus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading dicraurus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassland and woodland habitats. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can tolerate periods of drought. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
